tags: this is what i am thinking about today
thanks for coming to my ted talk
summary:
PETA: Pokemon supports animal abuse because you're forcing animals to fight to the death for your amusement!!
Me: Right right...
body:
PETA: Pokemon supports animal abuse because you're forcing animals to fight to the death for your amusement!!
Me: Right right but how do you feel about the ethical implications about Pokemon like Vileplume and Parasect who, technically, only evolve because the healthy juvenile version of the Pokemon developed an untreated parasitic fungal infection that took over their mind as it developed? Like Oddish in particular can evolve into either Vileplum OR Bellosom, with the implication being that Bellossom is the 'healthy' adult version of Oddish - but you get both of the final forms from GLOOM, not directly from Oddish, and Gloom is already showing signs of the fungus! So to get a Vileplum you have to not only ignore a dangerous fungal growth that will eventually take over your Pokemon's mind, but ENCOURAGE IT TO GROW instead of treating it.
PETA: Um-
Me: And we literally have never seen an evolved Paras without the infection! They don't exist! Can the raising of Paras even be considered ethical when there is no way to prevent the fungus from taking it over?
PETA: I- W-we don't-

dialogue.label: PETA:

Like Oddish in particular can evolve into either Vileplum OR Bellosom, with the implication being that Bellossom is the 'healthy' adult version of Oddish - but you get both of the final forms from GLOOM, not directly from Oddish, and Gloom is already showing signs of the fungus! So to get a Vileplum you have to not only ignore a dangerous fungal growth that will eventually take over your Pokemon's mind, but ENCOURAGE IT TO GROW instead of treating it.

title: Monday Musings 2/18
body:
Another week is here. Another 168 hours of trying not to be distracted by the internet, wait, has Final Fantasy VIII been announced for Switch yet?

  1. Well, my bipolar business strategy is alive and well. After selling my books at a convention, and hearing readers ask me where they can get more books and me being like: “Amazon has them. Grumble. Snarl. Snap.” I have decided to restructure my online

View On WordPress

blog.name: pines-pokemon-headcanons
blog.title: Professor Pines's Pokémon Posts
blog.description: I'm Professor Lilia Pines, ask me about pokémon! ((Headcanon/roleplay blog))

question: Feebas and Milotic?
answer:
I have some feebas information here and some milotic information here!

Feebas can perceive the same amount of colours that humans can, and are generally most attracted to the colour red. 

People have attempted to cook and eat milotics before, but their meat is reported to be gelatinous and gooey. This, combined with the species’s rarity, has led to milotic meat being viewed as a stereotype of ostentatiousness– something that a person would eat to show off their wealth, though it tastes awful.

Feebas do not have eyelids and their irises are fixed, meaning that they cannot adjust the amount of light that reaches their retinas. However, contrary to popular belief, bright light does not hurt their eyes.

Milobelle fashion– straight reddish-pink hair, long eyelashes, red eyeshadow and eyeliner, and blue and red patterned clothing– was popular among Kalosian noblewomen around two hundred years ago. It has resurfaced today in a more modern form, which tends to focus on the milotic’s different colours and shapes.

summary: [Image description: A digital colour drawing of three fake Pokemon that I created that are based on fairies and yarn balls. The...
caption:
[Image description: A digital colour drawing of three fake Pokemon that I created that are based on fairies and yarn balls. The images of the Pokemon are placed against stylised Pokeball graphics and each has a pink text box with relevant information next to them. This information is replicated in the artist’s comment below. The first Pokemon is Sewitch, a pink button with glowing eyes, a cross-stitch mouth, a bow on its head and yarn arms. The second Pokemon is Threspool, a pink yarn creature with four insect legs, a button head-plate, glowing eyes and a bow around its neck that forms its ears and arms. Its arms have yarn balls at the end and are raised defensively. The third Pokemon is Pinstress, a pink yarn creature similar to Threspool but larger and quadrupedal with longer ears and large needles on the end of its arms and a pincushion for a tail.]

I coloured in my Fakemon drawings and I’m making them into a Pokedex for my fan game. I have no idea if I’m going to be able to make it, since I’ve never made a game before and I don’t know if Nintendo likes people making fan games or not, but it was fun to make this anyway.

#10 Sewitch (Sew + Stitch)
Yarn Pokemon
Fairy/Normal

Is said to be created when thread is imbued with fairy magic. It steals clothes and unravels them to add to itself.

#11 Threspool (Thread + Spool)
Yarn Pokemon
Fairy/Normal

Its evolution has made it faster and more aggressive. Its yarn ball fists can hit surprisingly hard.

#12 Pinstress (Pin + Seamstress)
Needle Pokemon
Fairy/Steel

Has a cooler head than its previous evolution which makes it a ruthless tactician in battle. It fires its new-found array of pins and needles with deadly accuracy.

Evolution:

Sewitch -(lvl 18 with Yarn Ball)- Threspool -(lvl 36 with Sewing Kit)- Pinstress

These guys are basically glowing light fairies that make their bodies out of stolen thread and yarn. Evolving them involves finding more yarn for them and a sewing kit for Pinstress to get their pins from. They have several colour variations like Vivillon. Getting these variations involves taking them to a tailor in-game and paying to get them re-threaded. The pink or ‘Baby’ variation shown here is the default.

Eallana is meant to be Britain and the Sewitch line is inspired by sewing and knitting being popular British hobbies and also our many posh old tailor shops. The glowing fairy aspect of this line is inspired by Britain’s many folktales about fairies, but specifically about will-o-wisps, glowing fairy lights that lead travellers astray.

Font is 'Power Red and Blue’.

Photoshop CS4

Original drawing:

Link

Links:

DeviantART

Twitter

Instagram

25. Fanartist. Multifandom. 
THIS BLOG IS NSFW.

tags: I am so happy N and his sisters got away from that
but also there had to be some truth to the lie Ghetsis was weaving. why else would it work for like 15-20 years
summary:
zizi-the-blogger
 replied to your post  “Ghetsis A4, please!”
                        Oof, poor N? Though imagine if Ghetsis had...
body:
zizi-the-blogger replied to your post “Ghetsis A4, please!”
Oof, poor N? Though imagine if Ghetsis had a prosthetic and he just happened to need help getting it back on. XD

Yeah that’s basically the issue at hand : B

Ghetsis, I imagine, is pretty technologically capable just out of a self reliance paranoia in a very progressive society. After he was badly injured by whatever, he has the skills necessary to up keep his prosthetic running smoothly even without the help of the Shadow Triad.

However, whenever this happens, he needs help reattaching it. So just whoever is around will do, it’s not like it’s heavy; Ghetsis’s robes are probably heavier. He seems like too frank of a character to fuck around with people while working on it, but I am sure he’s said Dad jokes out of sarcastic necessity. N and his sisters are probably the ones who help the most for 1. They are always kept around so they are always in the castle, 2. Ghetsis is building the false sense of trust like an asshole, and 3. Even that grizzled, old evil fuck admits that it’s nice when the kids are around to ease his bitter, lonely soul. They have been victims to really bad, awkward puns and general comedic bitterness as they help Ghetsis reattached his prosthetic. 

Honestly, some of the only good memories N has of Ghetsis are during those moments, when his father was the most… human.

He seems like too frank of a character to fuck around with people while working on it, but I am sure he’s said Dad jokes out of sarcastic necessity. N and his sisters are probably the ones who help the most for 1. They are always kept around so they are always in the castle, 2. Ghetsis is building the false sense of trust like an asshole, and 3. Even that grizzled, old evil fuck admits that it’s nice when the kids are around to ease his bitter, lonely soul. They have been victims to really bad, awkward puns and general comedic bitterness as they help Ghetsis reattached his prosthetic. 

Honestly, some of the only good memories N has of Ghetsis are during those moments, when his father was the most… human.
trail.content:
zizi-the-blogger replied to your post “Ghetsis A4, please!”

Oof, poor N? Though imagine if Ghetsis had a prosthetic and he just happened to need help getting it back on. XD

Yeah that’s basically the issue at hand : B

Ghetsis, I imagine, is pretty technologically capable just out of a self reliance paranoia in a very progressive society. After he was badly injured by whatever, he has the skills necessary to up keep his prosthetic running smoothly even without the help of the Shadow Triad.

However, whenever this happens, he needs help reattaching it. So just whoever is around will do, it’s not like it’s heavy; Ghetsis’s robes are probably heavier. He seems like too frank of a character to fuck around with people while working on it, but I am sure he’s said Dad jokes out of sarcastic necessity. N and his sisters are probably the ones who help the most for 1. They are always kept around so they are always in the castle, 2. Ghetsis is building the false sense of trust like an asshole, and 3. Even that grizzled, old evil fuck admits that it’s nice when the kids are around to ease his bitter, lonely soul. They have been victims to really bad, awkward puns and general comedic bitterness as they help Ghetsis reattached his prosthetic. 

Honestly, some of the only good memories N has of Ghetsis are during those moments, when his father was the most… human.

blog.name: napkemon
blog.title: napkemon
blog.description: I'm a father of two young daughters. They both love Pokémon. Each day I doodle one on their lunch napkins, then share with the world. Please share 😉.
